freenet.node
Class NetworkIDManager

java.lang.Object
  freenet.node.NetworkIDManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable, Comparator<NetworkIDManager.PeerNetworkGroup>
public class NetworkIDManager
extends Object
implements Runnable, Comparator<NetworkIDManager.PeerNetworkGroup>

Handles the processing of challenge/response pings as well as the storage of the secrets pertaining thereto. It may (eventually) also handle the separation of peers into network peer groups.

Author:
robert

Nested Class Summary
 class NetworkIDManager.PeerNetworkGroup
          A list of peers that we have assigned a network id to, and some logic as to why.

Method Detail

handleStoreSecret

public boolean handleStoreSecret(Message m)
Stores the secret&uid contained in the message associated with the peer it comes from. "FNPStoreSecret" messages are *never* forwarded, they are only between peers as an alert that they may be asked for the secret from a third party.

handleSecretPing

public boolean handleSecretPing(Message m)

public void checkAllPeers()

onPeerNodeChangedNetworkID

public void onPeerNodeChangedNetworkID(PeerNode p)

inSeparateNetworks

public boolean inSeparateNetworks(PeerNode a,
                                  PeerNode b)
Returns true if (and only if) the connectivity between two given nodes have been computed and they have been determined to be in separate keyspace networks. Fail-safe false, if either of the two peers have been recently added, if this class is not past its initial startupChecks, etc.

compare

public int compare(NetworkIDManager.PeerNetworkGroup a,
                   NetworkIDManager.PeerNetworkGroup b)
Orders PeerNetworkGroups by size largest first. Determines the priority-order in the master list. Throws on comparison of non-network-groups or those without members assigned.

Specified by:
compare in interface Comparator<NetworkIDManager.PeerNetworkGroup>
